answers.answer: Please feel free to use more than 11 words in your post. There is not enough information to provide an appropriate answer.1.) Are you diabetic? If yes, how often do you test, your results, and what was your last A1c test results?2.) Were you out in the hot sun?  If yes, were you well hydrated?3.) Other known health issues? Weight? BP? Heart?etc, etc, etc

could be a number of things...Do you have diabetes? Have you ever had the pressure in your eyes tested?  Do you have high blood pressure?  It could even be a sign of a migraine.  It really depends on your overall health..and if you have any underlying conditions.

Yes I am a type 2 diabetic...it is well controled with oral medication. My blood pressure is on the rise and I am now taking 2 meds for that. Never had migranes and had no pain. I wasn't flashing electrical lines like I have so often heard about.  It was a large patch of swirling lines...kind of like if you put water and oil together and pressed between glass...with light shining from underneath and moving around...does that make sense? I could also see it with my eyes closed.  Any ideas?

This is beyond my t2 diabetes scope. Here's web pages a Google search found on 'swirling lights in peripheral vision". You might find what you're looking for there. Might also check with your local Pharmacist on drug interactions regarding meds, vitamins, and supplements you're taking.http://tinyurl.com/swirling-lights-vision

This is not very clear, " Might also check with your local Pharmacist on drug interactions regarding meds, vitamins, and supplements you're taking."Should be - Might also check with your local Pharmacist on drug interactions between meds, vitamins, and supplements you're taking which may cause adverse reactions.

question: seeing swirley shimmering lights concentrated on one side of my eye
title: Try again with vision problem question
